pageContext.description: Thin rectangular tang section, one side surviving neatly squared with v. slight lips along corner - hammered flanging; blade much distorted, prob. lenticular section; hints in odd places of original light groove inset from edges; twig-like protuberance at blade end - from original casting or remelt in cremation? although tip is apparently missing (end squared off) there is no obvious break there - prob. remelted into protuberance.
pageContext.surface: Poor rough surface varied dull to blue-greens, and dull grey-browns.,Broken into 10 pieces - possibly relatively modern - breaks fresh. No evid. for end of tang missing - likely intact. Much of edges thin to fine sharp edge no evid. for much of outline lost.
pageContext.toSearch: Crookes, Sheffield, Sheffield, South Yorkshire S10, UK
